intro: Sebastiania hispida var. laeta, commonly known as the Happy Sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces orange-red berries that are edible but often have a bitter taste. This plant is often cultivated as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
